body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Clear all breakpoints and set a single breakpoint where you want it. Launch the app using the debug launcher. Run a code path that would trigger the breakpoint.

The app stops at a seemingly random location (not anywhere near the original breakpoint, although it consistently stops at the same point relative to the original breakpoint you set).

I see two errors in the console:

```
ChromeProxyService: Failed to evaluate expression 'modelsToSave': InternalError: No frame with index 32.
ChromeProxyService: Failed to evaluate expression 'logger.': InternalError: No frame with index 32.
```

But, interestingly enough, if I open up the Chrome debugger (while doing the above as if normal debugging is to occur). The Chrome debugger actually breaks on the correct line, and you can see in the Chrome debugger window the source code for the dart file (correctly formatted) -- no idea how Chrome debugger is working perfectly and intellij is not.

And a screenshot just for good measure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1562915/162852866-666ab70d-ca86-4ffa-bf09-d76aa237ddd4.png)

comment_data.body:
And for clarification: my initial report was based on using IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition (version 2021.3.3)

But, I can also confirm the issue exists with the latest Android Studio download from the Flutter website:

```
[âœ“] Android Studio (version 2021.1)
    â€¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents
    â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from:
      ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter
    â€¢ Dart plugin can be installed from:
      ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart
    â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.11+0-b60-7772763)

```

Additionally, the Flutter DevTools gets it wrong as well if I use the Flutter DevTools web console to set the breakpoint. (And again, with the Chrome debugger showing exactly the perfect break point).

Is this something broken in Flutter / Dart then, and not the plugin?

related to an open issue regarding a change made in Chrome v100:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/101224#issuecomment-1092324782

title: Web Breakpoints Do Not Line Up In Intellij (But Do In Chrome Debugger)
